examples: the reports of the commission are often referred to in the media
synonyms: call attention to "he referred to errors in the article"

definitions.definition: direct the attention of someone to.
examples: I refer my colleague to the reply that I gave some moments ago
synonyms: assign "the matter has been referred to my insurers"

definitions.definition: (of a word or phrase) describe or denote; have as a referent.
examples: the term “rhetoric” almost invariably refers to persuasion
synonyms: cover More"these figures refer to only the year 2001"denote
designate "the name refers to a native village"

definitions.definition: pass a matter to (another body, typically one with more authority or expertise) for a decision.
examples: disagreement arose and the issue was referred back to the Executive Committee

definitions.definition: send or direct someone to a medical specialist.
examples: she was referred to a clinical psychologist for counseling

definitions.definition: read or otherwise use (a source of information) in order to ascertain something; consult.
examples: I always refer to a dictionary when I come across a new word
synonyms: have recourse to "the doctor referred to his notes"

definitions.definition: trace or attribute something to (someone or something) as a cause or source.
examples: the God to whom he habitually referred his highest inspirations

definitions.definition: regard something as belonging to (a certain period, place, or class).
